Lot of bad review I don't know why, If it's expensive for you why did you buy it? I want the Season pass and The Wild Run DLC soooo baaad, but i WAIT for the SALE... Blame the game because it's expensive, can't wait for the sale or what? I'm just disapointed in ppl.. Seriously, yea the game doesn't have proper physics, somebody said SIM? Nope... Doesn't have enough JDM and what? I drive then the new Muscle cars, I don't like them much, so what? What's your problem ppl?... Tell me, can't write the steam code in you play, and think they gave you trial version? You gave a bad review because they didn't tell you to write it there? Oh STEAM always does, before you start the game Mr. Gaben loves you.. but you just skip the window cuz why not... Hi there! :)I'm trying to be short as I can!I see NFS ppl! Cry for money maybe you can buy The Crew DLC I played NFS World for a while, really loved that game but EA stopped it (later i'm going to get back to this point). I was really doubtful about the Crew, my bro in law got in on Xbox one, the game was really ugly so I didn't planned to buy the game for a while, checked reviews it got worse I didn't want the game at all. I wanted to play a car game with my friend so we figured out we don't have a big selection. (Open world games) Tell me if I'm wrong. Got NFS 15'' on PC finished the game and it wasn't bad, gave me a little old NFS feeling like  05'MW. Now EA told the players we are getting updates etc. We got 1 medium update and 2 small. Then they told us that's it. I mean c'mon, they could told us , the game is a Demo... -.- New game coming in 17.. I compare The Crew to the NFS, why, because that was an open world sandbox game, yes there is Forza Horizon 2 on Consoles, but not on PC yet. Why is the crew better: Much less loading time, openworld(but it's not a small session), Tuning system(you are able to see the running parts), Cockpit cam, More updates (costs money but they take care of the game, not throwing it away), Whole US map which is pretty big(cruise without any loading time), Fun play tracks, Bikes, Dirt, Peoples on the street (like in MC LA remix), Fun events where you can get a car parts, league system, Fast n Furious sim.  * I'm still playing the game.*Good	  Loading time!  Fun with friends  Fast n Furious sim!  Large map  Small events  Day night weather cycle  Developer active  Different setup cars  Body tuning   Traffic, Peoples on the streets  Crowd scaring mustangs! :D  Show how many miles, kmeters driven. (it's cool i think) Perks,   Police chases   Many real places, racing tracks, GPS  Drag in the desert  Infinite garage space  Mobile garage/tuner  Leagues/rank/Fractions  Montly big challenges/1 2 hour long missions (without stop)  Manual transmission  If you unlock, or buy the part(Rims etc), you going to have it forever. Bad   Visual tuning, bad rice vinyls, expensive  Graphics (I wouldn't say bad but to compare to other games it's not the best, but I love it, low loading time, smooth play  Few glitches, everybody cries about these, have you tried NFS 15? When u are fallig through the map, in the longest race, sometimes you have to stop not fall through and wait for the map load... Yea these glitches are nothing, stop crying!   Physics are bad, Fast n Furious 4ever!   Not enough cars (  missing JDM  and M3 GTR :D) Few small missions are really hard, I mean just unfair sometimes.  DLC's little bit overpriced, have to wait for sale.   Boring music, you can fix it with old NFS tracks! :D   Silent engine sound (maybe fixed in dlc, i don't know yet)  RUF , what's the matter with Porches? I mean the same just sport ed... Lot of people crying about they are going for money with all the DLC's, you know what, I rather pay extra money for extra stuff than, 3 dlc's and the game is thrown away... Fine they are overpriced a little bit, but they are spending time to make it I don't mind, I don't have the Wild Run dlc yet, waiting for summer sale! :)At the beginning I was negative about the game, not it Turned to love, If you  were an old NFS World player I can offer the game for you, it's pretty good, RIP NFS W! Worth to BUY it ON SALE,Overall score 7.5/10

content:
y 10, 2015
												If you liked TDU or TDU2, you'll like this. It's essentially TDU2.5; i.e. flawed, but still the most ambitious open world racing available. It's just plain fun.GOOD. The world alone makes this game easily worth the asking price. The open world is AAA, the best in a racer to date, capturing a lot of diversity and the feeling of cruising in a big open-world. You might expect cities, highways, beaches, snow covered mountains, forrest trails, canyons, and (sadly only a few) in-world racetracks. But you're still likely to be surprised by the diversity here; swamps, dunes, salt flats, etc. The Crew's world is just a fun place to drive.NOTSOMUCH. It's always online, which I might like just to reduce cheating, but requiring always online and not providing dedicated servers seems janky. One poorly connected player can effectively pause a race on and off through the whole race. Running into random players in the world is a core concept that I like, but again, poor implementation means the open world is VERY sparsley populated. I'm hoping they can fix this, but as it is, one of the biggest features in the game feels half-arsed.Handling is on par with the TDU series - a better feel than full on cartoony arcade stuff like Burnout, but still very much (too much) cartoon racing. Also, the story is pretty cliche. But seriously, who cares about that in a racer?Some things fall short of what this team pulled off in the TDU series. The great weather and bouncy baja-esque mountain roads from TDU2 are gone. No motorcycles. The car selection is mediocre at best. And the ability to instantly challenge other players is missing.BOTTOM LINE. I'm still hoping for a talented developer with a serious budget to release a racing world like this with proper handling and a more polished take on seemlessly-integrated multiplayer. Until that happens, I guess this is as good as open world racing gets for now.

er 8, 2014
												I really like this game, and i see people comparing The Crew with TDU2 (Test Drive Unlimited 2) and these are not compareble because they are very, very different. The Crew is about your crew, its about exploring the world, its about driving your fully tuned circuit spec through the desert at 400+ km/h. Its about the community, beating records, driving together and completing insane faction races. But it is sertainly not without flaws, the AI is either the best driver ever completely ignoring the laws of physics like not needing to brake and drive 300+km/h through a 90 degree corner, or it will drive into every car and object available.Cons and prosCons:- Bad/unpredictable/unreliable AI- Few cars and brands- Bugs causing the game to crash (example: while browsing your collection theres a high chance of crashing)- Uplay (Let us choose between steam or Uplay)- Can be extremely difficult due to AI- And some minor stuff like: no big rewardsPros:- Great handling cars (trucks vs muscle vs sport cars etc feel very different)- Great graphics (though there's a bit too much lensflare sometimes)- Amazing attention to detail, lots of npc's and wildlife- Massive world to explore- Lots of stuff to do when you're not running through the campain- Different types of vehicle specs- Random moments which make you laugh your ♥♥♥ of with your friendsIf i were to rate it i'd give it 8/10.Even though there are bugs and the AI is a bit weird, its a great and fun game to play with your friendsHint: Ubiflop, if you delive anything less than 6+ cars when you release the dlc, i will nuke your ♥♥♥♥.

And TDU2 had such a GREEEAAAT story. And such a GREEEAT physics engine/handling model. That game was a joke, I'm starting to wonder if people launched that on accident.UBI$OFT MICROTRANSACTIONS HURRRRRREverything you can get from microtransactions is attainable with in game money, obviously DLC cars won't be but almost every game has that even. You can complain about microtransactions all you want, they aren't going away.SURVURS ALWAYZ DOWN!I haven't seen the servers down once and I've been playing since launch day, I also played in the closed beta, never saw it then either.I'm not saying it's a perfect game, I'm saying everyone is expecting a full fledged simulator when The Crew never set out to be that, it's revolutionary in the fact that there are so many different ways to customize your car, street, offroad, etc etc etc. I mean seriously somebody listed no working turn signals as a con, that's so petty. Yeah, the mirrors don't have reflection and some of the shifting animations are fudged, sometimes the character will act like there's a paddle shift and there isn't which leaves him changing gears by swatting the air. As far as I can tell not enough people even use manual transmissions in game to care about shifting animations. Overall this is an incredibly fun game with enough to keep me coming back for a while. I paid full price for it and I don't regret it.EDIT: 12/17I saw the servers go down once a few days ago, they were down for all of 15 minutes. Yeah I was butthurt but it was pretty quick. I'm still enjoying the game but there are a couple more annoyances. PvP is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, everybody has full driving assists on and never even has to think, they go careening off walls and guard rails and beat you by 4+ seconds while you're taking care to not hit anything.The factions are odd, there's 5(I think) factions in the game but only 2 or 3 actually have people. I just so happened to put myself on one of the ones with a significant lack of people and it takes me 20+ minutes to find a PvP match for the faction v faction mode. I honestly don't see why they put so many factions in the game.Uplay's "drivehub" is showing me news from 1-15-2015 lolEDIT NUMBER 2 12/17I'm gonna try and stop looking at the other reviews for this game, I just saw somebody complain that it is difficult to get a gold medal on challenges. LOL GIT GUD, THERES ALSO PLATINUM MEDALS IF YOU ACTUALLY WOULD PUT MORE THAN 2 HOURS INTO THE GAME. The challenges are exactly what they should be, CHALLENGING. ♥♥♥♥ing hell, you all want to be spoon fed yet you don't like the idea of microtransactions. Speaking of microtransactions, it's not like I can go buy the best parts right off the bat with real life money, I would first have to earn the part with a car, the spend real life money to put it on a TOTALLY DIFFERENT car. So in essence, I'd be spending my money to make another car just as good as one I actually earned the parts with. Yeah you can buy cars outright with real  money but without parts it doesn't matter. People are just being way too critical of this game because Ubisoft. I bet they turn around and call Far Cry 4 GOTY though...Edit 3 1/9So after getting over 120 hours and not seeing myself stopping I thought I'd throw out another update.I've seen the servers down here and there, they're fixed within 20 minutes though.I have one friend who everytime we try to crew up, it doesn't ♥♥♥♥ing work, so we have his brother get on and crew us up. (Until they patched that a couple days ago)Ubi announced they're going to fix mirror reflections, I hope you're all happy.First DLC coming out in a week, they'll be keeping that pace for about a year, supposedly.They're also fixing the biggest gripe, the AI chase catchup whatever you want to call it, it's getting patched next week, so basically every review for this game becomes null and void. >Everyone's face when Ubi is listening and patching ♥♥♥♥

content:
15, 2015
 Easily the best racing game I've ever played Popular criticisms include; "handling too much for an arcade game" Because it's not an arcade game"wheelspin is too much" because you're using a 250 horsepower shot of nitrous in a car with a 10:3 power-to-weight ratioUnfortunately because Ubisoft has listened to what they're hearing (ie; game hate faries on the forums) the AI has been brought down to a minimum.Game has a huge map, probably the biggest of any open world game so far, the car handling is amazing, physics are pretty much bang-on, the in-game community is great, the car customization could use some work but it's a very small kink in an otherwise well-oiled machine. As a veteran racing-game enthusiast (weird guy that 100%s gran turismo games) it took me almost 20 hours to get through the story mode watching every cutscene, the story is even good although somewhat generic, it's well done. If you're an open-world racing game fan this game will probably give you a weird feeling, traditionally we saw games where you could see it, but not necessarily go to it. With this that simply isn't the case, if you can see it in The Crew, you can almost always go there. 6 levels of customization put the game's huge map to use, they are fullstock, street, dirt, Perf (performance), raid (trophy trucks), and circuit (full-blown race cars) each with it's own merits and downfalls that add an unmatched level of diversity to the game.The options menu is even pretty comprehensive with toggles for anti-aliasing, even types of anti-aliasing. individual performance impactors with their own toggles, and full wheel support with multiple ways of customizing so you can tune it to your driving style. All in all a fantastic game, even after the career mode there's plenty to do and fun to be had. 9/10

												I would like to start off with the biggest reason I even recommend this game is because it is the closest thing we PC gamers have to Midnight Club L.A.I love and hate this game! What is does right, it does right! What is does wrong, it really does it wrong!I will only list the things wrong and missing in the game. It has everything else in my opinion!1. This is possibly the biggest one for me and I don’t really know why! The side and rearview mirrors don’t work! WHAT THE HELL WERE THEY THINKING! Almost every racing game has working mirrors!Racing games on mobile, last gen systems even the PS2 AND PS1 racing games had working mirrors!This seriously needs to be fixed!2. Not enough races or race types! There are plenty of street challenges… -_-There are so few races that I forget I’m playing a RACING GAME sometimes!3. Damage on cars are overdone in some places and underdone in others!If I hit a leaf, my whole front end looks like I hit a tree at 200mph! But glass wont break or even crack even if I roll my car! This just seems lazy!4. Textures look good on your cars and most of the environments. It’s not what you would expect from a next gen graphics game, but they look good. And with the size and scope of the game I would think they look amazing! Where is the bad? EVERY SINGLE PEDESTRIAN CAR AND THE PEDESTRIANS WALKING DOWN THE STREET! I have seen better textures on the PS2! I swear I am not exaggerating! They look horrible!!!I can’t even begin to figure out why they thought this was OK!5. Now on to the little things. No neon lights. Why is this a big deal? It is and isn’t. I like neon’s, what can I say? But in a game that is supposed to be an MMO, you need to have more customization!6. No window tints.7. Very limited on body parts.8. The game has a lot of rims to choose from, but 90% of them all look the same!9. Cant paint parts different colors.10. The performance parts system is kind of wack! Look it up on YouTube.11. Not a lot of cars to choose from. But at least they had my Skyline!12. Its structured as a F2P type game. Now that wouldn’t be such a problem if it weren’t for the fact that they are selling it for $60. Plus I have played some F2P racing games that felt more complete than this game that had WORKING MIRRORS! (Sorry, but I’m not going to ever let that go till they fix it).At any rate, the game is fun, not worth what I paid, but fun.Buy it on a sale, a BIG sale! Anything over $20 is way too much! But if you really want to play a game that kind of reminds you of Midnight Club L.A. then this is the game for you….Kind of.. -_-So yes I recommend it, even though is sucks!

												Fantastic game. Each spec you unlock changes how you play, and upgrading your vehicle is rewarding and challenging. Community events, plans for additional vehicles and features, and a strong fanbase/developer relationship means that The Crew has a bright future. The only downside is that a constant internet connection is required to play due to the MMO aspect, but considering no one seems to complain about World of Warcraft needing a constant network connection to play, I find it difficult to justify that complaint. If you're looking for a racing game that goes beyond what any Need for Speed title, especially the soon to be discontinued Need for Speed World, The Crew is just what you're looking for.

												This game is amazing: despite the Ubisoft logo.The map is 3x larger than GTAV, me and a friend measured Seattle to the Miami Keys and it's roughly 98.9 miles.Other than that, flawless launch from Ivory Tower, very good optimization for a game designed for high end pc's.It runs fine on my 750 Ti SC. My favorite parts is Death Valley, the Black Hills, even though I've only discovered only 6% of the map. I can't praise Ubisoft and Ivory Tower enough for The Crew. It is a huge check mark in the positive coloum for PC gaming. It's far from them earning their reputation back, but it's a very good start. Glitches and bugs are expected since this game is brand new.WIth nice little easter eggs and salutes to past racing game legends like Need For Speed World, Hot Pursuit 2010, Burnout Paradise, Shift 2 Unleashed, Test Drive Unlimited 1 & 2 and many more, The Crew is a hotbed of MMO racing that just feels right. How many other games out there can you tune a Ford GT to 700hp, and wreck a Koenigsegg Agera R? I can't think of many.Another huge check mark is the fact that the devs actually watch the forums; someone suggested that a free roam cam be added, like the one in NFS World, and within 12 hours someone from Ubisoft responded saying that something like that is in the works...Now that's rare now a days.

Well if you have friends that play it, yes, of you don't well it's still wuite fun as you can still find people online to talk with, but it is not as fun as cruising arround with your frineds. At the monent while typing this, there is a 50% discount due to the steam summer sale.I hope this helped you, and I would recomend this game. (Maybe due to my 88 hours playtime xD)

content:
y 4, 2015
 The Crew Review  This review will contain some stuff i love, like, dislike and hate about The CrewPrepare yourself--- Things I LOVE - The MapThe best map I have EVER seen in a racing game, and not the biggest, but the most diverse map I have EVER played on. It's that good. It would take a large amount of hours to completely explore the map. I still haven't completely expored it in my many hour playtime. It takes about an hour (if you are going very fast) tho get from one side of the map to the other. It just such a fun map to drive around, to take a road trip, and to see all kinds of fabulous landmarks throughput your journeys.-Everything about the carsAll the cars have lots of detal, interior and exterior. They are all different to drive, and unique in their own ways. Also, all the sounds for the cars are the legit real life sounds, recorded from the cars in a sound studion. SO nice.--- Things I like -Customization of carThe customization is quite good, especially compared to most of the recent need for speed games. The only problem is the customizations seem too concrete, there is no ability to add your own imagination or personal touch. Some stickers have different colors, but you can't change the color of a specific sticker. Also, each sticker goes on a certain, unchangable place on the car. You can make your car different than others, because there a large number of aesthetic parts and stickers.-Car specsI really like how the car can utilize many different utilities by changing the spec. There are 5 specs: Street, Dirt, Performance, Raid, and Circuit. They are all fun to experiment with. Some are great for the racetrack, while others are great for offroad trails. My only gripe about specs is that very few cars have the full 5 specs, most have 1-3 of the the specs. The starter cars all have the full 5 specs, so you will be able to have them all in at least one car.-The storyIt is surprising for a good story to be in a racing game, but in this case that surprise came true. It may seem cheesy and cliche to some people, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. -The graphicsThey aren't amazing by any means, but they are good. They capture american geography well (with a few minor hiccups) but there are many current racing games that have better graphics. They are definitely not bad though, they still make the game nice looking. The best graphics in the game are seen in some of the cutscenes. Legitimate movie quality cutscences.--- Things i dont like -The "mmo" aspect of the gameOnly 8 players in your session, and they players continually switch to different players, so, yeah, no. I still don't really know how to play with my friends, because there is no server choice, just places you in one.-Not that many carsThere really should be more.-Anything that has to do with AIOther racers, cops, even NPC traffic. All equally annoying.-Customization of your characterNonexistent. Hopefully you are okay with the way you look, cuz you can't change that.--- Things I HATE -ubisoft-uplay-ubisoft support-uplay servers-ubisoft bugs-uplay bugs-ubisoft glitches-uplay glitches-ubisoft in general-uplay in generalFortunately, ubisoft only published this game not developed, so it isn't UNPLAYABLE (i.e. ACU) a good company called Ivory Tower made it, which was responsible for some other open world maps (i.e. GTA 4) Some things about the game just seem buggy and unfinished, not because of Ivory Tower, but because of ubisoft. It just seems like with the many delays the game should be PERFECT but it isn't.And now, for the thing I HATE the most about the crew, the following is a reddit rant that i put onto /r/The_Crew/ :Originally posted by author of this review: There is one thing that i just can't get past about this game: THE MIRRORS DON'T WORK! I mean SERIOUSLY!!!!! WHY?!?!??! test drive unlimted from THE 80'S has working mirrors.
http:// http://i.ytimg.com/vi/xSvpmi79ZXY/0.jpg  <---FREAKING 8 BIT MIRRORS! and the crew doesn't. GAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHH
3 reasons why the crew doesn't have mirrors
1. ...
2. ...
3. ...
Don't get me wrong I love the game but.....I JUST CAN'T GET PAST THAT

Ok thanks for reading all that. I'm done now. The good conclusion:The game's main feature, a big map, is DEFINITELY true. The map, the cars, the graphics, all together make the game an great, interesting, and fun experience.The bad conclusion:The online, which was the other big feature, fails to deliver. There are many online problems and bugs that make some give up on the game. But I am not a quitter. My Rating:  8/10 Final conclusion (tl;dr) :This game offers an amazing experience, one that I have never seen in any other game. Simply being able to take a trip down a desert highway, explore a mountain, race around a city, and explore the entirety of the United states is something that no other game has ever done so beautifully.Overall great game, beautiful map, beautiful cars, just some problems that need addressing. My rating is subject to go up if those improvements are made. The crew is definitely my favorite driving game, and it will never get old or boring. With a map the size of the U.S., how could it? Happy driving!

												It's an assertion that doesn't make any sense! Ubisoft has sold The Crew as a racing game, and there are certainly plenty of parts where you drive your car really fast. Hell, there's a race in this game that's four hours long (more on that later).The Crew  isn't a racing game though. Not really. I have no doubt it was pitched as a racing game, and I know why it's being sold as a racing game, and it's because a racing game is something people can understand. It's the same reason Assassin's Creed needs some ridiculous science fiction frame story—because in 2007 the idea of an action game set during the Third Crusade wasn't "viable."

												Easy game to recommend. Loads of fun. Yes...I have a Nvidia card and had to rollback the drivers but not that hard to do to enjoy the game. I find moving from one course to the next to the next, repetitive and stale in a racing game. The open map, side challenges, plenty of cars to choose from, motorcycles, monster trucks.... a good variety that allows one to find different things to do and not get bored. On sale it's a great buy.

, 2016
												Before wild run, it was a really good game. It has a huge map, a very large selection of cars, and multiplayer, the career, and faction missions were fun. Now the game is unplayable due to Ubisoft's negligence to fix the game-breaking map rendering glitch. It's been there for 6 months, and whenever I play the game I encounter it and have to restart. It not only makes freedrive, career, and faction missions unplayable, but causes multiplayer to black screen until the person with the glitch leaves. TLDR: Ubisoft made the game unplayable and hasn't fixed it for 6 months. Don't buy it and think twice before buying any other Ubisoft titles.

2, 2015
												I really looked forward to this game because the idea behind this is very appealing. But unfortunately Ubisoft didn't do a great job of implementing.Positive things about this game, the map is huge and there is so much room for playing so that's certainly a good thing. The graphics are ok, but that is not something that bothers me too much. The idea to form a crew is also a good thing, but is poorly implemented and there are so much things to do with it to make it better, but they didn't. Faction races are great, but could be a lot better. For instance, make a race with a destination point and you can choose with route to take. The physics are not great, but not bad either. Only thing the cars should do is drift, instead of constant understeer.So yeah, there are a lot of things that could be done better and it really dissapoints. This game had a massive potential to become something great, but it didn't take that chance. Maybe The Crew 2 will be better, if that game will ever arrive of course. Not something you should buy i say, unless you really really want to.

content:
y 22, 2015
												Great game, storyline is solid. But you can't "customize" your car, you can only add packages, i.e. street package, performance package, with some flexibility otherwise. Graphics aren't the greatest, but gameplay is more important. Well, offline gameplay is, considering the community is full of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. What people like to do is form little posses of 3 or 4 cars, then find solo players just cruisin' around and run them off the road to the point where online gameplay is literally intolerable, since you can't drive anywhere. On top of that, grandma's Nissan has the same physics as a Dodge Ram 1500, so theres no way to defend yourself. To add insult to injury, I bought the "game of the year" edition, or whatever they're calling it now. So thats just 85 bucks down the drain.If I still haven't turned you off yet, I'd like to mention that you need UPlay to run this game. What's UPlay? It's like Steam, for Ubisoft. UPlay and Steam hate each other. It's nearly impossable to get in a game with people from your friends list because it's so hard to get Steam and UPlay to work together.Still need more? Recently there was an update for The Crew that added a new feature called "Wild Run". Wild Run is 25 dollars, regardless of whether you bought the season pass. What? I just paid 85 dollars for your game and I still don't have everything? Now, Wild Run includes a feature for the player to do races with other players, which was availible as a part of base game. Was. Now, unless you pay Ubisoft even MORE money, you can no longer play with other people, which was the original intent of the game; multiplayer co-op racing. Ubisoft just decided that it was a good idea to completely disable the most vital part of the game in favor of petty amounts of profit.Ubisoft recently released a new DLC for police chases called "Calling all Units" which I was really psyched for. Turns out, just like Wild Run, even though I have a season passI still need to pay EVEN MORE for this content. The Crew, plus the season pass, plus Wild Run, plus Calling all Units equals well over 120 dollars. Honestly Ubisoft, when does the money hoarding end?Screw you, Ubisoft. I'd give anything to get my hands on one of your devs right now.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
2, 2015
												While the story is somewhat entertaining, the gameplay is really quite boring. There's literally nothing to do but race around, and while it is a racing game, the trailers hinted at other forms of gameplay and much more exciting cinematics. It's not a bad game, but its not a good game either. The story is pretty minimal compared to most games, and trying to tie this story into a continually running server-based platform makes for some really annoying drive times.Also we were promised the whole country, as though that would be to scale. Nope. Everything has been scaled down so that most of the cities are a third of their actual sizes. I threw down a lot of money for this game because I thought I would be getting a lot out of it. Really, because of the setup we actually got, I say this game is worth no more than $30. If the animations and the LOD look right up your alley, you might be inspired to pay $40. But never is it ever worth the full AAA studio pricing.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------So now that we have Wild Run, I guess the only thing I can say is WHY didn't I get it with my season pass? Considering it adds modes like DRAG racing, DRIFTING, etc. that most racing games have from the start, I think it should have been a free update. I won't be wasting my money on Wild Run though. The gameplay as a whole is still really boring.

er 1, 2015
												I can't be more honest than that.The game is cool, Actually, Its pretty amazing.Tho i got some thing to say about it.First, I will start with the PROS i guess.SO THE PROS:-The world is huge. You can drive for hours. (I literaly finished a race with a 104 minute record.)-Theres a weather system, Also day and night. Which really affects the gameplay.-TONS OF CARS.-The game not stands for full singleplayer, You can make a crew (A some sort of group that will join your missions.) -Pvp (NOT ONLY RACING, Theres a lot of multiplayer pvp mods !)-Upgrading and modding your car... Oh man.. This part. You just need to see the customization. (Ps. Made me poop myself when first saw).-You can have a driving test before getting a new car-Theres Voice chat and a regular chat. (Also whisper, crew chat and etc)-Theres a lot more honestly just. idk less important for this review (You should also taste by yourself you know.)So ofcousre after Pros. I should hit with the Cons !-The biggest con by my opinion. Is the crashing system.Crashing into cards happends a lot (Even if you are not bad like me.) Lets say you gotta race inside the city and theres a turn left or right doesnt matter. Sometime, Because its a city after all, Theres cars waiting for that green light. Yea, In that moments youll find cars all over the road except to the right direction.I find it really annoying. Playing Perf spec (I guess the most fast cars in the game) On a road which is not straight inside the city totally can caus your death. (I did played a mission like that, i wanted to punch my screen, AND I CONSIDER MYSELF A CALMED PERSON.)[Woah thats a big con]^-When you buy a car, No refunds. You cant really regret it. Same with specs.-When theres a chat notification you dont really get it, You need to open the chat box, unless you make it visible the whole time, Which kinda disturbs.I must say, By my opinion once again, There is not a lot of cons to the game. Just really basic things. Handling isnt even bad. (Just on peft spec cars. Well thats because its ♥♥♥♥ing hard.) But yet the game extremely fun, and enjoyable.I really hope you enjoyed my review. Make sure to like it if it helped you so other can see it aswell. *SORRY FOR BAD ENGLISHHHHH*Peace and love sugars.

content:
, 2015
												This is a fun game for what it is. It is by no strecth of the imagination what the developers told us it was going to be and unless you feel ok with mucking around with router settings the "never drive alone" tag-line will be a confident slap in the face. But it is still a fun arcade racer that looks good and offers some really nice open world play with a lot of things to do from jumps and slaoms to classic exploring. Also once you get it to work PvP multi-player is fun and frantic. Same with the co-op part of the game. It is far from perfect but it is still one really good ride.That being said... It has some very shifty multiplayer and use som peer2peer solution limiting how many players you can run at the same time. It also have DLC and pay-only cars out the tailpipe.

content:
7, 2015
												Got it on sale for $40 - Gold Edition. Then it is worth the price. Screw paying $80, no matter how good.And this game is great :) The world across the US is amazing. Cities feel familiar and the modelling is excellent. Mini challenges always keep it fun. Story line is great, much better than NFS franchise (another EA horse beaten dead). The PVP lobby system not that good. My cars went from 200 through 800 during the story game and get matched up with 1200 cars. No point in racing even. Guess the lower levels are playing the story game.Driving is excellent and feels good handling. There quite a few neat tricks to learn. The different kind of cars drive great (street, dirt, perf, raid) and you get to upgrade the visuals to get amazing cars.I'll keep coming back to get a few 1200 rides and kick some PVP ♥♥♥. Well done guys, great game.

content:
6, 2015
												I bought this game because it was developed by the same team behind Test Drive Unlimited, TDU and TDU2 weren't top notch games in terms of handling, but they had this "charm", I found TDU2 so relaxing, I played it for hours and it was really fun just driving around the islands, it had its big flaws like the ridiculous handling but somehow it was fun. I expected the same calm and relaxing mood from The Crew, sadly one of its biggest selling point was their worst feature IMO, the change to RPG style ruined the game, the idea was good but the IA of your opponents is completely crap, to the point that the game wasn't fun to me at all but frustrating, I really wanted to continue playing this game but I just couldn't, I don't have the time I had a few years ago and the fun isn't there anymore, that's why I cannot recommend this game to anyone, it's not a simulator and  it's too arcade that it's not fun either, please note that I played this game with a Logitech G27 wheel, that made it worst because the game is intended to be played with gamepad for its ridiculous handling, TDU was playable but The Crew is not, and you can't progress through the missions if you don't level up, so you will find yourself wasting time on repetitive side missions in order to play the story missions.I hope that in the future there will be another Test Drive Unlimited, with the same idea but improved, if I wanted to enjoy 20 minutes driving trhough the beautiful Hawaii and Ibiza, without feeling pressure to level up or completing frustrating missions TDU was the one, maybe I'm wrong because I thought The Crew was going to be that game, and the team had a completely different idea of the game, but this wasn't the game I expected.

content:
12, 2016
												30 hours in and I still have much to do. The world is so damn big and traveling from point A to point B is not boring at all since the world is full of different challenges for fast and agile cars. Upon completing these challenges, you earn parts for your car. If you don't need the parts, you can send it to your garage which will allow you to build up another car in the future.Story missions have you racing against time, destroying crates of supplies, catching up to an NPC and making them crash, and more.This game has car builds for dirt, street, drift, raid, and circuit racing. I probably forgot one, but that list should show you that this game is the whole package.Jumping online with friends is as easy as meeting up at a certain location and grouping up. Most of the campaign can be completed with a friend.Warning about DLC:"Wild Run" is a DLC pack. You do not need it to enjoy this game, but you will occasionally run into cars and missions unavailable, but don't worry about it. I've been doing just fine without it, but I will pick it up on a sale because I definitely want this game to last even longer.

												If you looking for an arcade style racing game you better play this than any of the NFS games after Underground 1-2/Carbon/Pro Street.*Huge world with thousands of places to visit. Never race the same track again.*Open gameplay. Play the story, PVP, global tournament series, challanges, faction wars or just go and start chasing random people in the world. You chose to go single player, multiplayer or both. All in the same game.*Many different car types plus bikes all with specific race types and different strenghts/weaknesses (street, race, drift, drag, dirt, monster truck, etc)*customisation (not as in-depth as NFS UG 1-2 but still a nice addition)If you still not sure because of the mixed reviews wait for a sale and in worst case you can get a refund, but trust me in less than two hours it will suck you in.

content:
ber 2, 2016
												The Crew is a great game. simple as that, but it defineitely has areas that should be improved but first let me start with the positives.It is easy to progress through the game, provides a challenge, has a huge map to travel around, encourages open world driving by including street and dirt vehicles, beautiful landscape and monuments to visit, controller support (including steering wheel) and the endgame makes you feel like a god but, there are some flaws.cons:1. traffic- although this is pretty fun to dodge around in free roam, it can be really frustrating when you're trying to beat a mission where one mistake can ruin everything but it adds a challenge. The worst part is when you crash there is a cutscene that plays and will ruin your time even though you can skip it and also there are road block made by the AI because they crashed into the car themselves.(hopefully that made sense)2. Physics- This games physics are terrible most people can easily look up an example of this but for the sake of this review, i would list some for you. Some are: crashing into a wall and being sent into the air, hitting a little sidewalk will make you do a wheelie or crashing into a vehicle will push it aside instead of a collision.3. Short storyline- TBH this doesnt bother me as much as it does for other people. If youre looking for a racing game then this is a racing game. overall the story is pretty boring and short.4. The DLC- another thing that bothers other people, this game kinda forces you into the DLC but personally i bought the complete edition which saves a lot of money in the long run if you plan on buying this game because it comes with a lot of cars and the season pass (At this the the calling all units is coming out soon)(Side note) progression is too quick?- I dont know about anybody else but i beat the main storyline and hit the level cap pretty quickly within maybe 4 days of playing. This didnt bother me because i wanted the endgame cars that are fast. Also within a week of casually playing, i already maxed out a couple of cars and a motorcycle dont know if its just me or not but if you buy this game you will find out.5. glitches- This one kinda goes along with physics but while playing, there will sometimes be invisible bumbs in the road and when you crash on the wall occasionally you will get stuck in it or you will be on top of it and will probably have to reset to fix it.6. Online- This game requires you to be connected to the internet at all times not much to say here but its extremely easy to play with friends at least.Even with all these things i still would recommend this game especially if its on sale (I got it during the steam summer sale) Not going to lie this game needs some tweaks and shows a lot of potential. Perhaps future DLC will provide an even bigger map (although i doubt as that will take a lot of resources and time) In the end, if you are looking for a fun arcade racing game this is your go to choice, you can race solo or with friends and overall have a great time. although i said the physics need to be updated, it still makes this game enjoyable for messing around. I hope that if you reading this that you buy the game and expand this community.

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
28, 2016
												The Crew tries to be a driving game with something for everyone. You can team up with a group of friends for an epic road trip filled with fast-paced illegal activities, and seamlessly explore a massive map of the U.S., from the tip of Maine, all the way down to Miami, over to Los Angeles and back again, passing through other iconic cities along the way. Though it's true that all of this is possible, the experience isn't all that it's made out to be. The Crew tries to do a lot, and while it technically delivers the features it promises, it frequently stumbles over itself. There are brief moments of joy within, but just when you start to think the game's turned a corner, a bump in the road sends your joyride careening off course. When the best thing a racing game has going for it is the variety of environments it has to offer, you know something's amiss.You start off in the streets of Detroit, but it's not long before you're rolling through mountains, everglades, and forests. The huge maps and its colossal number of activities is intimidating at first, but that's great: the more places to go and things to do, the merrier. Story missions, which take you through a trope-filled campaign that plays out like a Fast & Furious sequel, send you from one region of the country to the next, and missions emerge out of the blue along the way. You street race, smuggle contraband, take down competing criminals, and tackle bite-sized emergent challenges that test your abilities behind the wheel while you're on the go. There are hundreds of things to do, but only some are truly fun. The problem? With so much ground to cover, The Crew feels and looks like it's stretched too thin, and it's evident from the start. The Crew's world may be massive and varied, but it's not good-looking. It's constantly plagued by texture and geometry pop-in, and looks generally outdated. People, buildings, the environment, and most importantly, the cars, are represented by disappointing models that suffer from an unsightly amount of aliasing.Keep in mind that if UPlay, PSN, or Xbox Live is down, you can't play The Crew, even if you just want to go solo. During my time with the game, I was booted due to server or connection issues on a daily basis, which was very frustrating. The most enjoyment you get out of the game's connected world comes from player-vs-player competitions, but even they have issues.

content:
er 3, 2014
Are you looking for a Next Gen racing experience? Go look somewhere else.UPDATE: 01/11/15After nearly 3 months after launch there were only 2 patches correcting minor stuff but not a single commitment from Ubisoft on addressing wanted features in the game. The Steam user satisfaction dropped its recommendation from 96% to 77% and it will continue to go down as more people figure out how little this game offers after 20 hours - which is a ridiculous little time for a MMO. --- CONTINUE TO STAY AWAY.I've pre-ordered The Crew Gold +Season Pass expecting that all publishing on hard working to bring a new concept of game would be delivered. After my first 8 hours with the game I'm never ever buying Ubisoft games at launch anymore (As I'm already doing with Assassin's Creed franchise since Brotherhood).The game isn't an evolution from what we've seen on the Beta phase, it is just a "stability" upgrade in all aspects. To be honest, the only thing I've seen implemented from what was asked on forums during closed and open betas was the ability to change the gear faster while on manual shift, almost everything requested by the community was ignored.To review the game I've used a Nvidia GTX-780 + i7-4770K overclocked, my personal impressions below:- Are you ready for Ubisoft concept of MMO? It was confirmed by Ubi Community Manager that the "bug of few people per map" is in fact working as designed since they believe 8 player per map is OK.For a game where the selling point is "Massive open world" this is a flaw. - Don't expect to be able to play multiplayer, cause it isn't working as it should. It took me about 50 tries to be able to do 1 single coop mission since the message "There is no one in your session" was constantly been displayed even while I could see about 10 players on the map screen. - Do you like driving from cockpit and using the rear mirrors? Hopefully not cause they we're NOT implemented at all you will see is a gray piece of junk that since it isn't showing your rear shouldn't even be there. Surprisinly and adding "more fun" to the randomness of this issue, when you put your view in 3rd person mode (behind the car)... TA DA! The mirrors magically start working! W-T-F!!!Lets pause for a little reflection:  Since 1987 we have working rear mirrors thanks to Test Drive 1 but not in this advanced "next gen" title? There is no other racing series considering doing the same crap.- Anti-Alising is so horribly implemented that even downsampling from 4K resolution to 1080p you will notice the jadded edges everywhere. Specially when you're wandering inside cities hopefully you will not bother on blinking edges in general scenario elements like fences and light lamps, buildings and cars as you will be near to have a convulsion. Surprisinly AAs seems to had worked a lot better with "wild nature" elements so trees and vegetation don't suffer in the same heavy way cities do;This is my tweak guide to correct the game Anti Alising to an standard expected by a Next Gen title:http://steamcommunity.com/app/241560/discussions/0/617321352146025421/?tscn=1417713397Still considering the fact that at DAY 2 I'm trying to manually override what was delivered in the "official pack" , Customer Satisfaction is barely achieved on that aspect;- Looking for Dynamic Lighting and Shadows? Bad for you cause your car and whatever is capable of emitting light doesn't create any shadows! Ugly absurd issues from WatchDogs are all back to terrorize people dreams of playing decent games;- Your car is the only thing on the screen that seems to be made with more than 20 poligons. When compared with your own, all other cars and objects are ugly and seems to be toys or re-used models from games launched back from 90's - Specially Mini Vans - Maybe they have used the same from SEGA Crazy Taxi? Seems very similar to me. ** This can be minimized using my Anti Alising guide - check the LOD BIAS section **- Real bad textures. If you stay like 5 meters from any building you will few like playing GTA3. Ambient Occlusion made them feel more alive but they're all ugly and not even close to HD;- Dust and smoke effects from Counter Strike 1.6 are better than what we can see here;- Offline mode isn't working. You need to stay online on UPlay or, once you get in the game, it will ask you to connect to UPlay and restart it;- There is  no dynamic weather at all;- Engine sounds are very generic;TL;DR:As it is right now, there is no reason why you should buy this game for more than 20 dollars. If you want a good looking racing experience, buy Shadow of Mordor and ride a Warg. I ensure you that your experience would be better than any hype you may have here and you will have a really good game.Besides that, give the game some time to have Ubisoft to fix its outstanding issues and the magicians from the internet to discover what Ubisoft have disabled under the hood to make it similar to the console versions.

content:
er 9, 2014
												So as you can see i have almost 1000 hours of gametime on The Crew.  I have played since the game was officially released and own almost every spec of every car.  When this game was released it got all kinds of terrible reviews but even at that time in it's incomplete state it was a good arcade style racing game compared to any NFS-type game before it.  Since that time they have added cars, stickers, colors, pvp options, graphics, race modes, bikes, monster trucks, 3 new specs (monster, drift, drag) in addition to the 5 already available (street, dirt, perf, raid, circuit), freedrive challenges, and tons of other things!  Some people will sit here and cry and complain about some technical issues with crashing, which is there from time to time, but with the amount of options they're adding to the game it's totally worth it.  Need For Speed is completely inferior to this game.  I have spent 125 dollars on this game including game, expansion pack, and season pass... I don't regret this at all because this game has been worth it!  There is no better open world arcade style racing game on the market right now (may 2016).

												To give you an idea i was in the beta before i had even pre-ordered the gold edition....I thought i liked this game and then game the delays, the broken servers, the crashing, no one on the servers, the microtransactions, the amount every car in the game costs ...seriously what car is that expensive, the falling through the map, the in car view is broken if you apply the handbrake during a turn, the buying of parts, the fact people were playing it before it was released, the broken physics, the fact that ive driven a 70s cadillac that feels like it would handle better than any of the cars in game, the fact that you dont get enough faction points or whatever to rank up at all seriously do you know how long a mission with good payout is. I still haven't been able to unlock my free supercar.Ubisoft screwed the pooch again...like right after you release one broken game you decide to release another how do you do this. It's like the level of glitches and broken code in new vegas, but without the modability. The game feels like alot of ubisofts other racing games as well but combined all recycled ideas to creat a steaming pile of "idea".The crew gold gives you a whole what 16 extra cars, for an extra $25. Think about that now that is alot of money for something i would consider what should be the size of one car pack. The crews Vehicle selection, what a fun topic. They seem to pick alot of old musclecars, some new muscle cars, some exotics, and 2 tuners..... a 370Z and an R34. No subaru's, no mitsubishi, no hondas, and no toyotas "not even a supra, a legendary car". Like do you hate imports that aren't considered exotics. If you do buy it wait a year until the price drops significantly, then also wait for a steam sale.

Introduction:An open world MMO racing game. For what was presented and explained the game is great and got the job done. For how much devs were needed to created something like this a lot of things should have been different. Seems like they took more time on the map than the cars what you can do with them. Pros:Great graphicsHuge mapGreat wheel settingsGood netcodeGood story/SP missionsCons:Not a good amount of cars to choose from (compared to Forza Horizon 2 and others)Low max levelOnce you're done with the campaign there isn't much to do except race others and try to get other carsMoney is too hard to get compared to how much cars costSometimes you won't see another player for 1+ hoursConclusion:Overall it is a solid racing game but there are some things that I would have liked to see. Maybe wait for discounts.For more reviews check out  Original Curators Group

I really don´t understand why i buy games in these days. To pay twice and more times to have complete game? I don´t think so.

content:
2, 2015
												The Crew is a game with so much potential that it actually upsets me playing it at points. There are a few main points of contention I have with the game.#1. The car list.Maybe there were licensing issues or something along those lines but the car list in this game is a massive disappointment. If you're making a game set in the entirity of the US give us some good American cars. I'd love to see classics like your C2 or C3 Corvettes, Pontiac Trans Am, Impalas, '60s Mustangs and even weird obscure stuff like a Buick Grand National. Another thing is that for a game released in late 2014 all the 'new' cars seem to be a few years old. For example you have a 2010 Camaro, a 2010 Challenger, a 2010 370Z, a 2010 Continental Supersports, a 2009 Corvette ZR1, a 2010 BMW Z4, A 2011 M5, a 2010 Focus RS, a 2011 Mustang, a 2012 V8 Vantage,a 2010 Viper, a 2011 Grand Cherokee, a 2011 F150 Raptor and a 2011 McLaren 12C. Maybe it was due to a lengthy dev time but it just seems strange to have a new racing game with a car list this slightly dated. Another thing that annoys me about the car list is that there is an R34 GT-R V-Spec that is Left Hand Drive, they only ever made them RHD that's why Americans who are into "JDM" (That's another rant for another time) go crazy for them.#2. The customisation.The vehicle customisation in this game is odd in that it's very in depth but also very limited. An example would be that I can put a stripe on my car but I can't change the colour of that stripe. All I want is a purple Camaro with a green stripe to give other players their daily dose but because of the arbitrary restrictions in the customisation menus I can't. All they had to do was emulate Forza or one of the PS2 era NFS games but Ivory Tower screwed that up.#3. The vehicle classes.When this game was hyped in pre release and during the beta it was shown that every car could be used in every class (Street, Dirt, Perf, Raid and Circuit) but when the game was released there were restrictions and limitations as to what car can be used with what class. For example a Golf GTI can only be used in Street spec which sucks because Street spec is garbage. A Dirt or Perf spec GTI would be fantastic but it can't happen because the game says so.#4. The Physics.Not necessarily the driving physics, they're fine but they do start out pretty terrible (they improve as your car improves) but the crash physics and impact physics are screwed up beyond belief with my cars commonly performing physically impossible maneuvers. Another thing that isn't entirely physics related is that during the start of every race an animation plays where you cars rear wheels spin even if you have a front or all wheel drive car, as someone who likes detail in their driving games this upsets me greatly.#5. Crew Credits.They're a currency you buy with real money. Need I say more?#6. The "MMO" aspect.This game is not an MMO. Ubisoft are lying to you, it might be multiplayer but it is 8 people per server and with a map this large you are spread out most of the time and barely have any interaction. The 'Never Drive Alone' tag was a lie as I spent most of my hours in this game driving alone.What this game needs is a sequel made by more competent devs and with more attention to the little details. It also shouldn't be marketed as an MMO because it isn't.

content:
r 20, 2015
												Well, i figured i might aswell write my first review as a review of this game. I just completed it today. Today being 4 days after i got it, and i've racked up just over 23 hours of playtime. And oh boy. Summed up, this game is essentially the result of throwing Test Drive Unlimited 2, Driver: San Fransisco and Need For Speed: Undercover intro a breeding pen together. Being a massive fan of TDU and the Driver series, i'd say that sounds pretty damn good. It has the exploration and collectibles of TDU2, the "undercover ex-street racer who was jailed up but picked by the FBI to catch bad guys" plotline, which i suppose is a mix of D:SF and NFSU, and then the attention to detail around the maps and customization of TDU2. The plotline is pretty short. Like i mentioned earlier, i completed the storyline within 23 hours, and that's with quite some extra time added into exploration. You could probably sprint trough the game in 17/18 hours. Though, the exploration is what makes this game so enjoyable. Like, for ♥♥♥♥'s sake, there's a unicorn and a bigfoot walking around for you to almost run over in your Paris-Dakar specced muscle cars and circuit spec classic cruisemobiles. The map is large. Very, very large. It's basically the entire US, and even though it's downscaled, you'll still spend over an hour getting from one end of the map to the other. It's also surprisingly well detailed, with a ton of stuff to discover, like a giant ski jump to launch your car off, or 5 different race tracks, or wrecked cars, which is another thing very similar to TDU2. It's a good time if you enjoy cars and exploring ♥♥♥♥. Oh, and TD;LR if you can't be arsed to read my ♥♥♥♥♥♥ review:  Ubisoft didn't ♥♥♥♥ up

content:
8, 2015
												I'll be honest: I was hyped as hell when i first saw the trailer.But I waited it to go on sale, and downloaded the trial version first. I was scared by the huge amount of negative reviews.I bought the standard version, no DLC, no Season Pass, they will come later, maybe, we'll see.The Season Pass is tempting me, but 24€ is just a little too much. I'll wait a sale.The driving feel and physics: doesn't feel totally right, I've had better, but it's not so awful as many had depict. Maybe it's just my steering settings, need to look into it some more.Rubberbanding AI: not found. Both when I got the lead and when I was behind, I felt no rubberbanding from the AI cars. Drive clean, with no mistakes, and who's behind will stay behind.Little update: the rubberbanding is noticeable in long races (>30 min), otherwise is pretty much nonexistant.It is not a simulator, at all.Later I'll add some more details, I need to go deeper in the game experience. Until then, it's a 7/10.Get it when on sale (30-50%).EDIT, 1/8: Damn me I bought the SP. Worth. Cars are really well made, only thing that bothers me are mirrors not working. In 2015. Come on Ivory Tower, you can do better than this. Still a 7/10 and still worth, even more if you have 2-3 friends to race with.PvPs are demolition derbies, never seen such unsportsmanship.Fun thing to do is dodge the oncoming opponent, watch the wannabe rear-ender fly down a cliff and taste his salty tears as he insults you in french.EDIT, 21/8/16: More than one year is passed and I STILL CAN'T GET ENOUGH of this game!However, some things really ♥♥♥♥♥♥ me off:- Wild Run and the incoming Calling All Units are not included in the Season Pass. Need more money, Ubi?- "Smart Loot" my ♥♥♥♥. Getting end-tier car parts is now an almost impossible task with all the useless vinyl/paint/rims drops. Either farm money and buy the parts from the tuner shop or get ready for some serious grinding.- Wild Run adds pretty much nothing compared to its price. No story, no challenges, no trials, nothing. Also, bikes behave like cars and your monster truck behaves like a normal car (don't expect to ramp through traffic Monster Jam style).- Car physics are a little too much uniform. Raid cars, for example: a 1750kg Dodge RAM jumps and swerves like a 950kg Porsche. Not good.- WE (at least I, for what is worth) NEED SOME BASIC CAR SETTINGS. High-end gearbox parts have ratios too low, the car in 5th gear does not pull without NO2. Only way to tune gear ratios is to install lower tier parts. ABSOLUTELY not good.- Still can't use custom music in the in-game radio. Seriously? Come on.The vote is still a 7/10, get it if you like roam around with some music (played in VLC), don't get Wild Run.Also, people complaining about game not working with Nvidia drivers or new GPUs: I have drivers version 372 with a GTX1070. Everything works flawlessy. Get your PC right before downvoting a game.

content:
, 2015
												PERSONAL OPINION Well, I'm going to tell you that this game needs a friend. Unfortunately, it doesn't come with one guaranteed.When I played this game/ both alone and with a friend, it is the absolute best racing/driving game I have ever played.No, I don't understand why there's so much hate. What do all those haters play, Need for Speed Rivals?All jokes aside; this game is definitely better than its competitors at its gen. I enjoyed this game thoroughly, and would rate it 98/100 (1 point minus for minor connectivity issues, 1 point minus for bad ending) Let me start with the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ map. Yes, the freaking huge map. And its not just 90% emptiness, no no no no....Its probably one of the largest maps in gaming history. I'm pretty sure it could go par against Guild Wars 2 in map size.Next up is the main story sequence. Overall, the story was NeedForSpeedMostWanted(2005)-ish and really pushes you to want to know more. Its not shakespeare but hey, I found it to fit okay.The cars in the game are well modeled (except their bottom; but who the hell looks there), and there is a pretty good level of car-modding. Okay, not Need For Speed Carbon/UG2 level, but at least around NFSMostWanted(2005) level. The paints choices are great, and the vinyl choices are not bad. They should make more though.I don't think there is alot of cars in the game, and before people start chirping the game because you can purchase cars; you can finish the game and get the best car without paying a single extra dollar. Just don't pay heed to purchasable cars and you're good. I personally liked their car choices; despite the low car count.The AI in the game (which some saw glitching) was actually flawless for me. They are pretty smart, and I'm pretty sure they are much better AI than that of older racing games. This is because the AI will not let you grind onto them or use them as "padding" as you make a sharp turn with them. They will speed up or slow down to make you screw up. It makes the game have a level of challenging in it.Okay, you got me here. The handling. Its not great is it? Well, I'm going to tell you that to each his own because me and my friend both just got used to it. I know, its kinda annoying, but it makes it a tad bit more challenging. It kinda forces you to learn how to properly turn and drift. Not sure if its realistic, but that doesn't matter for me anyway, it wasn't the end of the game. The graphics. This stuff is not your Driveclub or Forza graphics. But its definitely the right gen. I can barely run it with my computer but it looks amazing. Although there are some blotchy textures in shady places, the surrounding game has some good texturing.The Audio is good, but could use a little bit more bass/could sound more heavy.All the different specs you can get for your car, these are what fill in the "not enough customization" and "not enough cars" gap. The specs and their upgrades are well done, and they give the cars more specialization in what they do.The performance parts in the game are acquired by the means of completing mini-challenges or buying them at high levels. Of course, I didn't mind this as much but I could see why people would prefer buying them. Plus the model of the vehicle's inside does not change, no matter which performance part you pick. I did not have this game crash too many times, only twice from my many hours of playing and also once because my Eyefinity is not really compatible. I didn't find any bugs so far (minus my friend apparently being able do drive underwater once). The PVP in this game was decent, and the MMO-thing is not the biggest thing about the game. I played with a friend; as I said before, and we both really enjoyed this game.The challenges are a bit silly, but they are great in the case that someone wants to get some quick cash. The game's economy isn't that bad. Worth every dime of my 40$. TLDR; 98/100, huge map, get a friend, ending sucks, but overall an enjoyable game.

content:
3, 2015
												Updated: This is my final review. All of my review on thia game are base on gameplay and its features except story plot, as I always skip them like I do in other race game (except Split Second <3 ). If you have experience in Need For Speed Underground 2/Most Wanted (old), then you might have a same experience in The Crew, with different styles of course. Graphic is ok actually, and the control or handling car aren't that bad. So far it is good, it's cool to see other players during roam mode. Basicly the PvP (non crew pvp) is just same like other race game such Dirt 2, however, instead require host create a a lobby and organize the event, The Crew players that joined the lobby will vote which event they want to try. Haven't try yet the Crew vs Crew PvP (aka team vs team). Event after try I wont update anymore. xPDo caution that server in co-op/PvP is really terrible, most of time you'll get disconnected issue, not sure is this is really base on player's internet connection or it's the game's server issue..There's no rubberband Ai like those negative said, it's just normal Ai like other racing game. There's no perfect and logic Ai. It's yours skills to how you deal with them. Here's my screenshot. 


YouTube™ Video: The Crew Racing On Detroit's Freeway! 

			Views: 478		

			The Crew Racing On Detroit's Freeway! -Subscribe - https://www.youtube.com/user/renaldy75?sub_confirmation=1 -Follow me on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/renaldy75PC -Follow me on Twitter!		

Here's about Ai info I've been meet:Racer: •Like other game they sometimes can bit speedy or slow, even they speed is same as your. But as I said before, it's about your skills. For me, most Ai racer are very easy to handle. •Most of them stick into they waypoint, lika a train rail. There's a mission that I saw the same car hit on a truck twice (I retry the mission and yea, it occur on same place, same time). But meh, I play other race game before so its just normal.•A Take Down mission really annoying. Dunno how to explain lol.Cops, Police:•All right.. So far I only see two way to trigger chase. 1st, hit anything inside 'Police Watch' area, until they trigger chase. 2nd way is, hit the police car if you see them. If you guys know other way (than mission), please let me know coz its fun trolling them xP•All police just do is only ramming you. The star wanted level seems only increase number of police chasing you, road block and heli. Seriously roadblock is pretty ridiculous, only 1 police car block, with signal obstacles, in any wanted level. Please do not run from them by trying taking offroad, they'll chase you with dirt specs, also with heli, which is really difficult to escape if your car were using non raid/dirt spec. It was hell for me to run from them using Golf inaide forest but it was fun. xDNote: For those people who is don't have a clue about trial issue, copy your CD key in Steam Library and paste it at Active Product on uPlay.Please also do note that the trailer is too promising. I suggest you to try demo 1st. Well, it's still fun and cool racing game I ever played, 2nd of my fav after Split Second.Here's my review so far:-Pros:Big detailed mapAble to see other players roaming around. It's cool!Nice graphicSomewhat it's challenging. Seriously, sometimes there's too many cars (obstacles) on trafficNo cut-scene crash/accident like Need For Speed series (if you think this is cons it is pro for me. I hate when speeding in race or in free roaming, or while eescaping from police you got crash and then a cut-screen, slowing down you).Support are nice, I guess.Most time updateGreat communityCrew vs Crew PvP systemGreat car customization. You can tune your car to into various specs which is street, dirt (rally actually..), raid, circuit. You can't tune Stock specs but you can customize its visual on your HQ.8 players on each roam map is great, I guess.. Assuming enable more players will make the map lag, like most online game I played. Even though the map is very super large scaled getting lag will make player frustrated and stop play. This is my experienced in most online game. At least for me.Cons:Crew Credits systems in-game, in PAID games. Some car cannot bought through bucks. This should not happen. (Note: ingame progress you'll receive free 100k crew credit once. But as I said, Crew Credit supposedly not exist since this paid game, also can make game unbalanced.Season Pass benefit kinda unfair for me. Plus it is expensive, not worth for its features. DLC also expensive.Kinda unrealistic physics.Must have internet connection to play.Ingame player's profile avatar are using uPlay avatar, and can't upload/customize ingame profile avatar like the trailer.. This is so frustrating, stupid, and horrible..Thats all from me. :)My rate: 8/10

content:
ber 27, 2016
												They're giving it away for free right now, so you may as well give it a shot.Got it on sale, I definitely wouldn't buy it for full price. Graphics are pretty good, car exterior detail and rain are especially attention grabbing. The car sounds are really weird and probably a weak point-it sounds like they were synthesized rather than recorded. The game world is huge and the detail is pretty good considering the size, but it feels a lot emptier than any of the competition. The driving physics are pretty good and beginner-friendly and you can turn off the assists if you want. Nothing on the level of say, Forza Horizon but much better than Need For Speed 2015. The tuning is probably the biggest advantage-there are a ton of parts for every car. Bodykits, interiors, wheels etc and many cars have widebody versions in the "Perf" tuning spec. That brings me to the car selection. There are about 60, I think, plus their various tuning kits. This would be fine but the selection is a bit dumb- we get a Cadillac Escalade but no CTSV for instance. Attention to detail is where a lot of the cars fall apart-cockpit gauges are often off, or in some cases don't even work. You also can't sell off unwanted cars either which I don't get. The money system is annoying but not horrible. The game doesn't nickel and dime you that bad and you can make a lot doing skills and just drifting around, but the system is definitely skewed to try and get you to buy stuff. Cars especially are super expensive but you can test drive them before you buy which is nice. Parts are cheap though and handed out for free for doing skills.It's a fun game but the world feels a bit dead at times and a lot of car appearance and spec details are overlooked. You can get lost just driving around for a long time though, and you can turn off the road at any time. Pick it up while it's free or try the trial and wait for a sale.

ry 28, 2016
												Let me just say, the animators at Ivory Tower really pulled it off. This game is full of any form of racing action: time trials, races, takedowns, chases etc. It has an unravelling plot design, and a huge plot twist waiting for players. In depth missions and public events so you can meet new people and recruit them to your "Crew". Full customization of your car in different specs, or classifications, of vehicles.  The only problems I came across while playing was that the physics could be a little off. Overall, it was an incredible game and any fans of racing games will fall in love.

Sometimes if you hit the rear of a police car, you just get stuck (you cant even reverse, the game bugs. Sometimes that happens even at stationary cars when you are NOT the most wanted) and that you cant just turn around and reverse during a pursuit without being arrested.

content:
1, 2016
												I genuinely like the crew as long as you make sure you purchase Wild Run this dramatically improves vehicle handling and adds motorbikes and monstertrucks to the mix as well as dynamic weather and visual improvements. The map scale is truely impressive and the car models are of very high quality making ownership of these cars a real joy to cruise around in. The sigleplayer Story expeience is always down to the wire with nailbiting races and the AI can screw up although not as much as a human will.The Multiplayer option is good and encourages competition as well as working together to finish that hard as balls mission.The in vehicle views and bonet views are very well done and add to the immersion.If I had anything negative to say it would be about inapp-purchases. NO Ubisoft NO. I want to be able to earn my vehicle and drive against players that have earned their new rides instead of people who can just buy the best vehicle and get all the advantages from that.PROS : Graphically stunning as long as you have Wild Run. Incredible scale and detail to the map it truly is MASSIVE! Vehicle Models are of the highest quality. A genuinely fun and exciting story fo the campaign (although generic)AI vehicles can screw up making it more realistic. CONS:INAPP-PURCHASES gives some players unfair advantage over a player who earns their vehicle in game . I don't expect to pay any more when Iv'e supposedly bought the whole game. Get rid of inapp-purchases for sanity's sake it cheapens the whole product.AI drivers can be TOO smart never missing corners and seemingly completing courses with ease they also recover way too quickly as opposed to the player who is heavily penalized for screwing up.

content:
er 20, 2014
												-Short and Sweet-If you know what your buying, did your research and understand its an MMO-R-RPG, with future free updates and DLC, Know what it is: Arcade-ish, Horizontal progression, minor vertical progression, open-world. Know what it is not: Not realistic racer, no massive important story, a game thats been out for a long time. Side notes: the BS thats being said about fixing up your cars, complete BS, Every spec, every car has its own style and body parts, i havent seen a clone of my skyline yet. Also iv been helped out by lvl 50's many times, just my Quick Cooping, iv made friends and raced on open streets for no good reason. Story missions done with rando's then friend requested. The car parts are like MMO's loot systems, you gotta complete something to get the upgrade part.Theres a lot of BS comments revolving around this game.The game is what you make it. Thats why its called Open-World. Also if you notice, some of the reviewers that talked ♥♥♥♥ on the game, still play it, GG.

content:
r 20, 2015
												Let me begin by saying I do not have much experience with racing games, I am not a big racing fan. With this in mind I will continue my review.  I really liked the Crew, I have played it a little bit and I took place in the Wild Run beta testing. Overall I would say the game is a fun racing game, and it has some beautiful, and amazing environments in game. Driving coast to coast is an experience, and there is even a miniature version of my city in this tiny version of America. I will admit the actual driving can be a little clunky at times, but I feel that the other features and all the crew based gameplay makes up for it.  I have not played the Crew much, but I can at least say that there is not much it compares to. I haven't played many open world racing games like the crew, but I can say this, it seems well made, especially for a Ubisoft game. If you are still reading this far into my review, you should know that I recommend the Crew to street racing fans, and fans of open world racing games. That being said I must warn you that the Crew comes with Uplay, it is a Ubisoft game, with all that entails.

content:
ber 16, 2016
												So I bought this game day 1, when it came out on 360, and too be honest, it was dissappoining then. However, since then this game has become much better. There are still a few things that need to be addressed. Until the Cops vs Racers update, I'd give it a 7/10. Once the new update is here, depending on what gets fixed, it might go up.1) Open world. And I mean OPEN WORLD. The map is immense, go any where you want to go. It literally takes almost an hour to drive at 150mph to get from NY to LA, and that's if you don't get distracted by something shiny. 2)Envornment. Might not make a difference in how your vehicle handles. However the change from forest to snowy mountains to desert adds life to the game. the addition of wildlife also adds a nice touch. challenging when your going 180mph in a McLaren and then DEER!!!!3)AI. Ubisoft still has some work to do on this one. However, compared to what it was at the beginning, massivly better. The cities actually feel like their alive to a point. Its also neat when your in the countryside, theres no where near as much traffic as in the city.4)DLC. I know most people don't like paying for extra game. However, the DLCs have brought much needed content to the game, and has greatly added to the depth of the game.5)Graphics. They are just fantastic to look at, and i have a $50 low resolution TV, so imagine if a High-def TV is used. I can see the individual drops of rain on the windshield.6)The cars. What car game can be complete  without the cars. I still felt that there were too few cars, maybe about 35 total with the DLC. They have been adding new cars for free however, so there's still hope for this one.7)Cops. Ok so this is probably my biggest irritant. The cops are well, easy to beat. They don't really present a challange. However, they do set up roadblocks, PIT you, and they have even down the rolling box on me. However it is so easy to get away. On this one, Im waiting too see what happens with the new cops vs racers uodate in November. 8) Physics. Kindy goofy. For those looking for a simulator level of driving, go look elsewhere. Its got a arcady feel to it, which for me its fine. If I wanted simulater I'd go play Forza.9)Always online. With good internet connection, you can still play and not deal with anyone else. They'll still be there, but it doesn't force you to interact with them. However it would be nice too have a offline option. Eventually Ubisoft will have to add it in. They cant keep the servers up forever.10)Story. Really short. Feels kind of forced at times, and makes you go "wha" at times. But i didnt get tis game to watch cutscenes, i got it to take a sportscar off roading and launching it off cliffs, because why the F--- not.Overall, I give this game 7/10. It is fun racing game that can make hours dissappear. Id wait til its on sale to get it. Get the one woth all the packs. It'll make the game that much better too play.
